xwikidoc.name: ConfluenceContentbylabel
xwikidoc.creator: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.author: xwiki:XWiki.Admin
xwikidoc.title: Confluence bridge for Content by label
xwikidoc.content:
The contentbylabel macro is a bridge between Confluence and XWiki. It displays a list of documents given a list of tags or a complex query in the Confluence Query Language (CQL) syntax.
= Parameters =
|=Parameter|=Description|=Required|=Default |**labels**|A list of tags to use, separated by a comma or a space. This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set.|If cql is not given|(empty) |**operator**|Whether all the tags should match (AND), or any (OR). This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set.|No|((( OR ))) |**max**|Maximum number of results|No|(unset) |**sort**|What to sort on. The only supported values are "modified", "creation" and "title" for now. Ignored if an ##order by## clause is present in the cql parameter.|No|(unset) |**reverse**|Whether to reverse the sort (true) or not (false).|No|false |**spaces**|Confluence spaces in which to search. ##@self## for the current space. ##@all## for everywhere. This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set.|No|(empty) |**title**|A title to display before the results|No|(empty) |**cql**|A query written in the Confluence Query Language (CQL) syntax defining the list of documents to show. [[See the documentation>>https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CQL/#HSyntax]].|If labels is not given.|(empty) |**showSpaces**|Whether to display the Confluence space in which the documents are (true) or not (false).|No|true |**showLabels**|Whether to display the tags of the documents (true) or not (false).|No|true |**type**|What Confluence type of objects to show. This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set. Only known value: page.|No|(empty) |**excerpt**|**This parameter is ignored.** Whether to show excerpts of documents (true) or not (false).|No|false |**excerptType**|**This parameter is ignored.** Whether to show "##simple##" excerpts or "##rich content##" excerpt.|No|(unset)
= Example Usage =
{{code}} {{confluence_contentbylabel cql="label = 'contentbylabelexample' and space = currentSpace()" showSpace="false" sort="title" title="This is the title of a contentbylabel macro" max="5" reverse="true" type="page" labels="contentbylabelexample" spaces="@self"/}} {{/code}}
Result:
{{confluence_contentbylabel cql="label = 'contentbylabelexample' and space = currentSpace()" showSpace="false" sort="title" title="This is the title of a contentbylabel macro" max="5" reverse="true" type="page" labels="contentbylabelexample" spaces="@self"/}}

contentDescription.name: contentDescription
contentDescription.prettyName: Content description (Not applicable for "No content" type)

property.code:
{{include reference="Confluence.Macros.CommonCode" /}} {{velocity output=false}} ## See https://solr.apache.org/guide/solr/latest/query-guide/standard-query-parser.html#escaping-special-characters ## And https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-2926 #set ($solrSpecialChars = ['+', '-', '&&', '||', '!', '(', ')', '{', '}', '[', ']', '^', '"', '~', '*', '?', ':', '/', '\', ' ']) #set ($escapedSolrSpecialChars = ['\+', '\-', '\&&', '\||', '\!', '\(', '\)', '\{', '\}', '\[', '\]', '\^', '\"', '\~', '\*', '\?', '\:', '\/', '\\', '\ ']) #macro (escapeSolr $v) $stringtool.replaceEach($v, $solrSpecialChars, $escapedSolrSpecialChars)## #end #macro (contentbylabellink $d) ## $escapetool.xml($d.getDisplayTitle())## ## #end #macro (getSpaceFacet $space) #set ($facetNumber = $space.getReversedReferenceChain().size() - 1) #if ($space.getRoot().getType().toString() == "WIKI")) #set ($facetNumber = $facetNumber - 1) #escapeSolr("$facetNumber/${serializer.serialize($space)}.")## #end #end #macro (executeMacro) #if ("$!xcontext.macro.params.title" != "") **$services.rendering.escape($xcontext.macro.params.title, $xwiki.currentContentSyntaxId)** #end #set ($results = $NULL) #getCQLMacroResults($xcontext.macro $results) #if ($results.empty) No results. #else #set ($tagsDoc = $xwiki.getDocument("Main.Tags")) {{html clean=false}}
    #foreach ($r in $results)
  • $services.icon.renderHTML('page') #set ($d = $xwiki.getDocument($r.fullname)) #contentbylabellink($d) #if ($xcontext.macro.params.showSpace != "false") #set ($confluenceSpace = $services.confluence.spaces.getConfluenceSpace($d)) #if ("$!confluenceSpace" != "")  (#contentbylabellink($xwiki.getDocument($confluenceSpace))) #end #end #if ($xcontext.macro.params.showLabels != "false")
      #foreach ($tag in $r['property.XWiki.TagClass.tags_string'])
    • $escapetool.xml($tag)##
      • #end
    #end #end
{{/html}} #end #end {{/velocity}} {{velocity}} ## We need to check if there is a valid license because the macro is registered even if the user doesn't have view right ## on the macro definition page. See XWIKI-14828: Rendering macros defined in wiki pages are available to users that ## don't have view right on those pages. #if ($services.licensing.licensor.hasLicensureForEntity($xcontext.macro.doc.documentReference)) #executeMacro #else {{missingLicenseMessage extensionName="proMacros.extension.name"/}} #end {{/velocity}}

property.description: Confluence Bridge for the Content by label macro

property.name: Confluence bridge for Content by label

property.description: The CQL query to use to find items
A title to display before the results
Whether to display the Confluence space in which the documents are
Whether to display the tags of the documents.
What to sort on. The only supported values are "modified", "creation" and "title" for now. Ignored if an ##order by## clause is present in the cql parameter.
What Confluence type of objects to show. This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set. Known value: page.
A space-separated list of tags to use. This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set.
Whether all the tags should match (AND), or any (OR). This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set.
Confluence spaces in which to search. @self for the current space. @all for everywhere. This value is ignored if the cql parameter is set.
